user_message:
Target function code is:
```c
static void
MHD_ip_count_lock (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->master);
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex);
#else
  (void) daemon;
#endif
}
```

List additional symbols that are required to analyze the target function to determine if the target function code violates the following MISRA C rule:
A function parameter should not be modified. Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
The list will be included in the prompt for the next agent, so be concise and clear.
Explain why each symbol is required in the analysis of the target function for the MISRA C rule.
explanation:
mhd_assert: Could be a macro or function; its expansion might reference or (rarely) assign to the parameter expression. Provide its definition to confirm it does not modify the parameter variable 'daemon'.

MHD_mutex_lock_chk_: Could be a macro or wrapper function that receives &daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex. Its implementation/definition is needed to ensure it does not perform any assignment to the 'daemon' parameter (e.g. via macro expansion that reuses the identifier or side-effects that overwrite the pointer variable).

struct MHD_Daemon: The type definition (layout) is required to verify that per_ip_connection_mutex and master are members (so the code uses a member access, not an operation that could modify the pointer itself) and to ensure taking &daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex cannot mutate the pointer variable. Also needed to see whether any unusual member aliasing or bit-field definitions might affect analysis.

MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS and MHD_USE_W32_THREADS: These compile-time macros determine which branch of the #if is active. The active branch decides whether MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (and thus any potential modifications) are actually present. Their defined/undefined status is required to know which code to analyze for MISRA C compliance.
